p: Inspection of the docking poses for the two examined compounds revealed their ability to fit perfectly in the active site of the DprE1 enzyme establishing different types of interactions ( Figures 4 and 5). The oxindole ring in both compounds 5g and 5h was engaged in two H-bond interactions via its carbonyl oxygen (C = O) functionality with His-132 and Tyr-415 amino acids. Furthermore, the NH of the hydrazide linker and the nitrogen atom of the pyridine ring were involved in H-bond interactions with His-132 and Asn-385, respectively. Moreover, the nitrogen atom of the pyridine ring in compound 5h achieved an extra hydrogen bond interaction with Cys-387 which may explain its higher energy score than 5g. Worthy of note, the N-isobutyl group of compound 5h established several hydrophobic interactions with non-polar residues lining a hydrophobic pocket, such as Pro-116, Val-121, Ile-131, and Ala-417.
